text: Managing and tracking your expenses is one of the crucial steps towards financial freedom. It is a habit that helps you keep an eye on where your hard-earned money is going. This helps in avoiding unnecessary expenses and eventually boosts your savings. You also have more money for specific goals like investments, children’s education, vacations, and a mortgage. These apps offer one-tap insights about your spending habits to help you make relevant changes. Here are the best expense tracker apps for Android you can try in 2025. Quicken Simplifi Quicken Simplifi is a budget planner and expense tracker app with tools to help you manage your finances effectively. It delivers custom reports and deep insights about your savings and expenses. The app offers automatic categorization of expenses and sends real-time alerts. Users can adjust their budget and data at any time. You get a detailed breakdown of expenses like bills and subscriptions. It lets you create custom savings goals, track investments, and check total net worth. Simplifi does not have a free plan but offers a 30-day money-back guarantee on the paid plan. Download Quicken Simplifi YNAB YNAB (You Need A Budget) is one of the well-known expense trackers and budget planners out there. It focuses on making you more financially sound, so you can spend money smartly and eventually boost your savings. This is the reason it takes a little more time and effort to get going with the app. It lets you set spending and savings goals to help you achieve them. It has a loan calculator that tells you how much time and interest you will save if you spend more money towards it. You can share your subscription with up to six people. The good thing is that YNAB has a 34-day free trial. Download YNAB PocketGuard PocketGuard offers an easy-to-follow and intuitive approach to finance management. It helps you keep an eye on your expenses, net worth, and cash flow. It’s “In My Pocket” feature calculates your disposable income after accounting for expenses, bills, and savings goals. It has a bill tracker and subscription manager to help you avoid missing payments. PocketGuard offers a free plan, but it is very limited. Apart from the usual monthly and annual plans, it has a lifetime membership plan accessible through the app. Download PocketGuard Rocket Money Rocket Money is an app that allows users to track monthly expenses and create a budget. One unique feature is that it can reduce your bill by negotiating on your behalf. It also helps you take control of subscriptions and can even help in cancelling unwanted ones. The app sends alerts so that you can keep expenses in check. It also supports net worth and credit score monitoring. Download Rocket Money Goodbudget Goodbudget is an expense tracker app that offers a digital version of the traditional envelope budget system. You create digital envelopes aka categories for different expenses like groceries, eating out, and debts. It encourages you to spend money for a particular category from its envelope. This approach should help you spend money carefully and save money for your goals. You can also share your budget with family members. The only issue is that you cannot link your bank account. It means you will have to enter every transaction/expense manually. This is the reason it is mainly for beginners who are looking to keep an eye on expenses.
